---
title: "Books"
---

**Books are not required for the course. All of the books are suggested**. 

1. **Machine Learning with R, the tidyverse, and mlr** by `Hefin I. Rhys`.
The book is available on [`Manning Publications website`](https://www.manning.com/books/machine-learning-with-r-the-tidyverse-and-mlr). The hard copy of the book is not required. Online copy is fine. 

![](images/mlr.jpg){fig-align="center"}


2. **Python Data Science Handbook: Essential Tools for Working with Data** by `Jake VanderPlas`. The book is available on [`Github`](https://jakevdp.github.io/PythonDataScienceHandbook/). The hard copy of the book is not required. Online copy is fine. This is the first edition of the book. The second edition of the book is also available. If you are interested, you can buy one from [Amazon.](https://www.amazon.com/Python-Data-Science-Handbook-Essential/dp/1098121228/ref=asc_df_1098121228/?tag=hyprod-20&linkCode=df0&hvadid=598359496472&hvpos=&hvnetw=g&hvrand=4220629731472346384&hvpone=&hvptwo=&hvqmt=&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl=&hvlocint=&hvlocphy=1016344&hvtargid=pla-1660857166929&psc=1) 


![](images/python-data-science-handbook-pdf.jpg){width="30%" height="30%" fig-align="center"}

3. **Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow** by `Aurélien Géron`.
The book is available on [`Amazon`](https://www.amazon.com/Hands-Machine-Learning-Scikit-Learn-TensorFlow/dp/1492032646). The hard copy of the book is not required. A pdf copy of the book is available from me on request.  

![](images/mlpython.jpg){fig-align="center"}


* **Supplemental Reading**

01. `R for Data Science` by `Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund` is an excellent book to learn about the basics of `R`. The [`online version`](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/) of 2nd Edition of the book is available free. 

![](images/r4ds2.jpg){width="30%" height="30%" fig-align="center"}

02. To learn about the mathematics underlying many Machine Learning (ML) algorithms, `Mathematics for Machine Learning` by `Marc Deisenroth, A Aldo Faisal, and Cheng Ong` can be used - 

![](images/math.jpg){fig-align="center"}

03. To learn about the Ethics in Machine Learning, `Fairness and Machine Learning` by `Solon Barocas`, `Mortiz Hardt`, and `Arvind Narayanan` can be used. The book is not needed to be purchased. An [`online version`](https://fairmlbook.org/) of the book is available.

![](images/thumbnail_large.jpg){width="30%" height="30%" fig-align="center"}

04. To learn about how to deploy Machine Learning Models into Production, `Machine Learning in Production: From Models to Products` by  `Christian Kästner` can be used. The book is not needed to purchase. An [`online version`](https://mlip-cmu.github.io/book/index.html) of the book is available. A github repository for the course is also available [here](https://ckaestne.github.io/seai/) and [here](https://mlip-cmu.github.io/).

![](images/ml_in_production.avif){width="30%" height="30%" fig-align="center"}
